required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Three Part Study of MGV354 in Ocular Hypertension or Glaucoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Three Part, First-in-human, Randomized, Double-masked, Placebo-Controlled, Safety, Tolerability and Early Efficacy Study of MGV354 in Healthy Subjects and in Patients With Ocular Hypertension or Glaucoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if the clinical profile of topical-ocular MGV354 merits further development for the indication of lowering intraocular pressure (IOP).

detailed_description.textblock: Part 1 will evaluate the safety and tolerability of single ascending doses of MGV354 compared to placebo in healthy male and female subjects. Part 2 will evaluate the safety and tolerability of MGV354 in a multiple ascending dose design (two highest tolerated doses from Part 1) compared to placebo when administered for 7 days to patients with ocular hypertension or glaucoma. Part 3 will explore the safety, tolerability and efficacy of a single dose level of MGV354 (maximum tolerated dose) compared to placebo when administered for 7 days in patients with ocular hypertension or glaucoma.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Change in Diurnal IOP (Averaged Over 8 AM, 10 AM, Noon, 4 PM, and 8 PM) From Baseline to Day 8
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. Diurnal IOP was defined as the average of the five time points measured (8 AM, 10 AM, noon, 4 PM, and 8 PM). Baseline diurnal IOP was the average of IOP measurements obtained at the 2 eligibility visits. Change from baseline was calculated by taking the change at each time point from baseline to Day 8 and averaging the available changes. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Change in IOP From Baseline to Day 8 at 8 AM, 10 AM, Noon, 4 PM, and 8 PM
primary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. Baseline IOP was the average of IOP measurements obtained at the 2 eligibility visits. Change from baseline was calculated by taking the change at each time point from baseline to Day 8. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Change From Baseline in IOP at 36 Hours and 48 Hours Post Day 7 Administration
secondary_outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. Baseline IOP was the average of IOP measurements obtained at the 2 eligibility visits. Change from baseline was calculated by taking the change at each time point from baseline to Day 8 and averaging the available changes. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, .5, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post-dose, and Day 7 post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. Cmax is reported as mass/volume.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Time to Reach Maximum Concentration [Tmax (h)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, .5, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post-dose, and Day 7 post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration [AUClast (ng*h/mL)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, .5, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post-dose, and Day 7 post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. AUClast is reported as mass*time/volume.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to 120 Hours Post Dose [AUC0-120 (ng*h/mL)]
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was to be collected at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to Infinity [AUCinf (ng*h/mL)]
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was to be collected at each time point.
Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was to be collected at each time point.

Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. Cmax is reported as mass/volume.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Time to Reach Maximum Concentration [Tmax (h)]
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 2: Area Under the Concentration-time Curve From 0 to the End of the Dosing Interval Tau [AUCtau (ng*h/mL)]
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. AUCtau is reported as mass*time/volume.
Accumulation Ratio was derived using Cmax on Day 7 versus Cmax on Day 1. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point.

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 3: Observed Concentration at 12 Hours Following Drug Administration [C12 (ng/mL)]
secondary_outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. C12 is reported as mass/volume.

arm_group.description: Part 3: MGV354 ophthalmic suspension, 1 drop in both eyes once per day for 7 days
Part 3: MGV354 placebo, 1 drop in both eyes once per day for 7 days

intervention.description: Inactive ingredients used as placebo comparator

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects were recruited from 5 study centers located in the US.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: This study was conducted in 3 parts. A separate cohort of subjects was enrolled for each part. Of the 191 subjects enrolled (Part 1, 2, and 3 combined), 79 were exited as screen failures and 14 were discontinued prior to randomization. This reporting group includes all randomized subjects. A zero indicates no intended subjects.

group.title: MGV354 0.01%
group.description: MGV354 ophthalmic suspension 0.01%, 1 drop in the study eye (Part 1)

group.title: MGV354 0.03%
group.description: MGV354 ophthalmic suspension 0.03%, 1 drop in the study eye (Part 1) or 1 drop in each eye for 7 days (Part 2)

group.description: MGV354 ophthalmic suspension 0.3%, 1 drop in the study eye (Part 1)

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo, 1 drop in the study eye (Part 1); 1 drop in each eye for 7 days (Part 2 and Part 3)

baseline.population: This analysis population includes all randomized subjects who received at least one on-treatment measurement of IOP (Full Analysis Set).

measure.title: Intraocular Pressure (IOP)
measure.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in millimeters mercury (mmHg). Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.
measure.population: IOP analysis was pre-specified for Part 3 subjects only.

outcome.title: Part 3: Change in Diurnal IOP (Averaged Over 8 AM, 10 AM, Noon, 4 PM, and 8 PM) From Baseline to Day 8
outcome.description: IOP (fluid pressure inside the eye) was assessed using Goldmann applanation tonometry and reported in mmHg. Diurnal IOP was defined as the average of the five time points measured (8 AM, 10 AM, noon, 4 PM, and 8 PM). Baseline diurnal IOP was the average of IOP measurements obtained at the 2 eligibility visits. Change from baseline was calculated by taking the change at each time point from baseline to Day 8 and averaging the available changes. A more negative change from baseline indicates a greater improvement, i.e., a reduction of IOP. Only one eye (study eye) contributed to the analysis.

outcome.title: Part 1: Maximum Observed Concentration [Cmax (ng/mL)]
outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point. Cmax is reported as mass/volume.
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, .5, 2, 4, 6, 12, 24, 48, 72, 96, 120 hours post-dose, and Day 7 post-dose
outcome.population: This analysis population includes all subjects who received IP, had at least 1 plasma sample following exposure to non-placebo IP and had no known specimen collection or analytical deviations which would affect the integrity of the data (Pharmacokinetic (PK) Analysis Set). Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with data at visit.

outcome.title: Part 1: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to 120 Hours Post Dose [AUC0-120 (ng*h/mL)]
outcome.description: Based on plasma samples collected at pre-determined nominal time points, dependent on observed concentrations. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was to be collected at each time point.
outcome.population: Due to the low exposure and the limit of the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ) (0.05 ng/mL), none of the observed individual profiles could generate valid AUC0-120.

outcome.description: Accumulation Ratio was derived using Cmax on Day 7 versus Cmax on Day 1. Approximately 2 mL of venous blood was collected at each time point.
outcome.population: PK Analysis Set. Number Analyzed is the number of subjects with data at visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were collected from time of consent for the duration of a subjects participation in the study (Part 1: up to 37 days, Part 2: up to 50 days, and Part 3: up to 59 days).
reported_events.desc: AEs were obtained through solicited and spontaneous comments from subjects and through observations by the Investigator as outlined in the study protocol. This analysis population includes all subjects exposed to investigational product (Safety Analysis Set).
